description: From Old French pr√©destiner, from Medieval Latin praedestinare. Displaced native Old English foreteohhian.

verbs.description: predestine (third-person singular simple present predestines, present participle predestining, simple past and past participle predestined)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To determine the future or the fate of something in advance; to preordain.
(theology, transitive) To foreordain by divine will.
